WorkItem.Description:
sometimes, if i use
  WorksheetWriter.PasteValues(doc, worksheetPart, "A", 2, values, CellValues.String, null); where values is a List<string>, 
opening the generated .xlsx results in an error message of Excel complaining about a corrupt file.
 
this does not happen all the time and is not easily to reproduce. mostly it happens when the row used as target already contains data in some columns. 
 
kind regards,
Tom
WorkItem.Summary: WorksheetWriter.PasteValues sometimes creates a corrupt .xlsx file if List<string> is used

Comments.Message:
Hi Tom,

If you could attach a small corrupted .xlsx file, I'll try work out the problem.
